Nelson Sullivan Video Collection

Contents

Series I: Video recordings, 1976 - 1988

Arrangement

This collection has not been arranged by an archivist. The materials are arranged in the order in which they were received from the donor.

Ameri/cain Gothic by Paul Carter Harrison, undated

31142063429545box: 1, media: ID: 357.0001 (Material Type: moving images)
31142063420163case: 357.0001 (Material Type: access dvd)

Scope and Content

This video shows an undated performance of Paul Carter Harrison's play Ameri/cain Gothic, starring Sylvia Miles and Moses Gunn and directed by Woodie King, Jr.

Conditions Governing Access

Currently available.

Physical Characteristics and Technical Requirements

Original format: VHS

Now Explosion at the Pyramid Club, November 16, 1983

31142063429545box: 1, media: ID: 357.0002 (Material Type: moving images)
31142063420171case: 357.0002_pt.1 (Material Type: access dvd)
31142063420189case: 357.0002_pt.2 (Material Type: access dvd)

Scope and Content

Part one of this video from November 16, 1983, shows Nelson spending time in the Pyramid Club dressing room prior to a performance by the Atlanta, Georgia, band The Now Explosion. Among those in the video are Deloris French, John Sex, and members of The Now Explosion.

Part two of this video is a continuation of The Now Explosion performing at the Pyramid Club. After their performance, there is a dance contest with Doctor Tony and Joan Ransom from the PTA, then footage from the Pyramid Club dressing room after the show. Finally, there is footage of a party Nelson attends in "Bobby and John's" apartment.

Conditions Governing Access

Currently available.

Physical Characteristics and Technical Requirements

Original Format: VHS

Chelsea Hotel (tape #1), November 20, 1983

31142063429545box: 1, media: ID: 357.0012 (Material Type: moving images)
31142063420288case: 357.0012_pt.1 (Material Type: access dvd)
31142063420296case: 357.0012_pt.2 (Material Type: access dvd)

Scope and Content

Original Tape 1 (of 2)

The first disc of this video starts with footage from the morning of November 20, 1983, when the Chelsea Hotel lobby is being prepared for a party. Nelson goes to room 604 to spend time with friends, including Sandy Dancer, Michael Musto, and Deloris French. Sandy Dancer prepares for her performance later in the day. When a news camera crew interviews Sandy, she says that the party is a birthday celebration for the Chelsea.

The second disc begins with people flowing in and out of room 604 while Sandy Dancer finishes preparing for her performance. There is a dance performance in the stairwell before the main party in the lobby, where, among others, Sandy Dancer and Michael Musto perform. Ed Koch appears after a couple songs in order to honor the Chelsea Hotel on its 100th anniversary and declare November 20, 1983 Chelsea Hotel Day. Koch also presents playwright Arthur Miller with a plaque honoring his time living at the Chelsea. Miller gives brief remarks before the unveiling of his plaque. Ulick O'Connor speaks on behalf of the history of the Chelsea, and there are a couple more performances.

Conditions Governing Access

Currently available.

Physical Characteristics and Technical Requirements

Original format: VHS

Chelsea Hotel (tape #2), November 20, 1983

31142063429545box: 1, media: ID: 357.0003 (Material Type: moving images)
31142063420197case: 357.0003 (Material Type: access dvd)

Scope and Content

Original Tape 2 (of 2)

This video documents performances and a party in the Chelsea Hotel lobby on November 20, 1983. Towards the end of the night, someone in the hotel accidentally pulls a fire alarm and everyone moves outside temporarily. Among those featured are Sandy Dancer, Sylvia Miles, and Cookie Mueller.

Conditions Governing Access

Currently available.

Physical Characteristics and Technical Requirements

Original format: VHS

Current DVD is damaged and skips from around 56 minutes to 58 minutes.

Joshua at Darinka, June 13, 1986

31142063429545box: 1, media: ID: 357.0004 (Material Type: moving images)
31142063420205case: 357.0004 (Material Type: access dvd)

Scope and Content

On June 13, 1986, Nelson films a performance by Joshua at Darinka. The Because Family Picnic (John, Dina, and Joshua) performs in between two sets by Joshua. For a short amount of time, Nelson goes backstage and speaks with the performers. The video ends with Nelson walking alone down the street.

Conditions Governing Access

Currently available.

Physical Characteristics and Technical Requirements

Original format: VHS

White Trash Night at Pizza-a-Go-Go, October 10, 1984

31142063429545box: 1, media: ID: 357.0005 (Material Type: moving images)
31142063420213case: 357.0005 (Material Type: access dvd)

Scope and Content

The video starts with Nelson and friends driving to Pizza-a-Go-Go for White Trash Night on October 10, 1984. When they arrive, Nelson wanders around the building before Michael Musto and the Must's performance starts. He bumps into Musto in the dressing room getting ready and warming up. Then, Michael Musto and the Must perform covers of popular songs by girl groups. After the show, Nelson goes backstage with the musicians and others for a while before going to the kitchen, where a Beatles cover band is performing. Then, Nelson and friends drive around and end up in a cafe.

Conditions Governing Access

Currently available.

Physical Characteristics and Technical Requirements

Original format: VHS

Tabboo! and Shazork at Limelight, April 1, 1986

31142063429545box: 1, media: ID: 357.0007 (Material Type: moving images)
31142063420239case: 357.0007 (Material Type: access dvd)

Scope and Content

Nelson and his friends get dinner near the Chelsea Hotel before heading to Limelight for a show on April 1, 1986. When they arrive at Limelight, Nelson records the performers getting ready to perform in the dressing room. Then he moves to the dancefloor to record the audience before Tabboo!'s puppet show. After that ends, Shazork (Lady Bunny, DJ Dmitri Brill, and Sister Dimension's band) takes the stage. After the show, Nelson heads back stage briefly before leaving Limelight and heading to the a restaurant, where the video ends.

Conditions Governing Access

Access DVD available by appointment only.

Physical Characteristics and Technical Requirements

Original Format: VHS

Atlanta: RuPaul at Weekends and Larry Tee's Celebrity Club, February 1986

31142063429545box: 1, media: ID: 357.0008 (Material Type: moving images)
31142063420247case: 357.0008 (Material Type: access dvd)

Scope and Content

The video starts with RuPaul gogo dancing at the Atlanta nightclub Weekends on February 27, 1986, then Nelson goes into RuPaul's private dressing room with Larry Tee and a couple of others. When RuPaul finishes his set, he joins the group. The video jumps to the next day, with Nelson spending time in a friend's house. His friend then gives him a tour on a drive through Atlanta on their way to lunch at Burton's Grill. The tour continues before they return to the house where Larry Tee and others have gathered to watch some recorded performances. Larry Tee then takes Nelson on a drive to what will become Larry Tee's Celebrity Club for a tour, which is still under construction. The video jumps again, to Nelson chatting with drag queens (Sultra, Wanda, and others) getting ready for the night and then doing a private performance/interview for Nelson. Finally, the video jumps to recordings of music videos by Spencer Thorton for The Now Explosion, RuPaul, and an unknown band. The video cuts off at the beginning of a clip titled "RuPaul, Tune-Up King."

Conditions Governing Access

Currently available.

Disc two is a continuation of the Butthole Surfers footage. Nelson leaves 688 with friends, and the last eleven minutes contain no footage.

RuPaul at Danceteria, October 12, 1984

31142063429545box: 1, media: ID: 357.0009 (Material Type: moving images)
31142063420254case: 357.0009 (Material Type: access dvd)

Scope and Content

On October 12, 1984, Nelson attended RuPaul's performance in Danceteria. The video starts with a group getting ready in RuPaul's dressing room, then shows all of the performance, featuring special guest Miss Felicia. After the show, Nelson goes backstage to congratulate RuPaul and Felicia on the show, and he spends the rest of the recording the group hanging out there.

Louise Nevelson in Conversation at the Guggenheim, March 5, 1986

31142063429545box: 1, media: ID: 357.0010 (Material Type: moving images)
31142063420262case: 357.0010 (Material Type: access dvd)

Scope and Content

Nelson and Sylvia Miles attend a dialogue between sculptor Louise Nevelson and critic and editor of New Criterion Hilton Kramer at the Guggenheim in this video, dated March 5, 1986. The conversation is in celebration of Nevelson's being awarded The Great Artist Series Award by New York University's Gallatin Division, for her contribution to international art and culture. After the talk, Nelson and Sylvia go to the reception in the Guggenheim's rotunda, where they speak with Louise.

Conditions Governing Access

Currently available.

Physical Characteristics and Technical Requirements

Original format: VHS

Casanova by Ethyl Eichelberger, March 15, 1986

31142063429545box: 1, media: ID: 357.0011 (Material Type: moving images)
31142063420270case: 357.0011 (Material Type: access dvd)

Scope and Content

Nelson records performers getting ready for the March 15, 1986 show of Ethyl Eichelberger's campy comedy Casanova at the Performing Garage, starring Eichelberger, Lady Bunny, Lola Pashalinski, Katy Dierlam, and Barbara Wise. Nelson briefly goes backstage after the performance, where among the crowds, Sylvia Miles and Peter Hujar are present.

Conditions Governing Access

Nelson's Birthday, March 15, 1986

31142063429545box: 1, media: ID: 357.0016 (Material Type: moving images)
31142063420346case: 357.0016_pt.1 (Material Type: access dvd)
31142063420353case: 357.0016_pt.2 (Material Type: access dvd)

Scope and Content

Disc one of this video starts with Nelson receiving a phone call from Liz to make plans on March 15, 1986. Then Nelson spends time with his dog, Blackout, and his cats, Freddie and Eddie, telling them that it's his birthday. He takes Blackout for a short walk before heading to 7A Cafe to meet his friends, including Michael Musto. Nelson, Michael, and Liz then travel to Musto's family home.

In disc two, Nelson, Michael, and Liz finally arrive at the Musto's family home in Bensonhurst and chat with Michael's family. They then drive to Albert's new house, receive a tour, and eat dinner. Nelson, Michael, and Liz leave Albert's apartment, and the video ends with them in the car.

Conditions Governing Access

Currently available.

Physical Characteristics and Technical Requirements

Original format: VHS

Scope and Content

This video documents the March 23, 1986 at The Zulu Lounge, including a performance by Shazork (Lady Bunny, DJ Dmitri Brill, and Sister Dimension's band). After the show, Nelson spends a little time backstage with the band. It also shows the May 1, 1986, Lady Bunny and Dimetri performance at Southern Funk Cafe.

New Year's Eve at Pyramid with Love Delegation and Shazork #2, December 31, 1986

31142063429552box: 2, media: ID: 357.0033 (Material Type: moving images)
31142063420536case: 357.0033_pt.1 (Material Type: access dvd)
31142063420544case: 357.0033_pt.2 (Material Type: access dvd)

Scope and Content

On disc one, Nelson is backstage at the Pyramid Club with friends as they wait for the performances on New Year's Eve. Nelson then heads to the dancefloor for a set by Peter Zaremba's Love Delegation with Wendy Wild and Liz Luv from Das Fürlines.

On disc two, Peter Zaremba's Love Delegation's performance continues. After the set, Nelson once again goes backstage. Throughout the video, a drag queen naps on a couch while everyone parties around her, but Nelson keeps returning to her. Shazork takes the stage and performs. The video ends with Nelson and the band backstage.

Scope and Content

[1] -- Cab ride home, 6/14/1987 [2] -- Michael Musto and Albert on Street ("Food Rap"), 6/14/1987 [3] -- Pop Tarts at China Club, 6/14/1987 [4] -- 5 Ninth Avenue, 6/15/1987 [5] -- Eric and Hapi Phace go to Park Opera, 6/16/1987

This DVD is divided into 3 parts:

Part 1 features Michael Musto and Larry T listening to musics and rapping on a street corner of New York.

Part 2 is a continuation of Nelson following his friends. He records his car ride with Larry T.

Part 3 allows us to get a tour of Nelson's bedroom, filled with a shoe and tie collection, oil painting supplies, and an editing center. Nelson and his friends then take a trip through a New York City park and bump into some acquaintances, Carey, Rose, and their baby Emily, while walking around.

31142054896504box: 16, media: ID: 357.0586 (Material Type: moving images)

Scope and Content

[1] -- House Party & Twilight Zone, 6/19/1987 [2] -- Thanksgiving (part 2), 11/25/1987

Dated for June 19th, 1987, Nelson starts his night in an apartment with a group of friends, including Michael Musto, who are listening to music and playing the guessing game "What am I?". The video transitions to the group visiting the party downstairs. After going back upstairs to the main apartment, Nelson makes a plan to go home as his friends go to Cafe Sandino, while Michael Musto, James St. James, and Michael Angelo make their way to "The Tunnel" for the night. While back in his own apartment, Nelson talks to the camera face to face about his plan to visit Coney Island the following day. The the view cuts to a dinner with his friends.

Scope and Content

At 11:30 pm on March 5th, the night starts with plans to visit Mars Bar for bingo night. Without hesitation to catch the light green sign that spells out "DRUGS", Nelson Sullivan filmed this particular footage for an HBO special at the "Mars Needs Bingo" event that happens once a month. Features Lahoma Van Zant, also referred to as "Bingo Carla", who is offered a part in a short film for the New York Lesbian & Gay Film and Video Festival. Later in the evening, the viewer is provided backstage access before a RuPaul dance and vocal performance during "Gay Night" at Mars Bar. The announcement of the passing of Steven Comb, who died from AIDs, was announced. Lastly, we are given the opportunity to experience backstage access after the show with a small cameo of Michael Musto.

Marrs & then Nelson goes to PYRAMID to see Bunny, January 29, 1989

31142054896504box: 16, media: ID: 357.0601 (Material Type: moving images)
31142062731396case: 357.0601_pt.1 (Material Type: access dvd)
31142062731404case: 357.0601_pt.2 (Material Type: access dvd)

Scope and Content

Part one of this video entry provides its audience a chance to construct a vision of nightlife in New York. Nelson and his friends are on their way to The Pyramid Club to catch Lady Bunny's voice performance sets. This specific entry possesses footage of the entire first set and part of the second. Also features a drag performance of First Ladies Nancy Reagan and Barbara Bush doing a musical duet of "Bosom Buddies".

Part two of this video is a continuation of Lady Bunny's second performance at The Pyramid Club, along with a "Sister Dimensions" performance of an original poem. At the end of the show, after recording the ambiance of the backstage area and entire area of the venue, Sullivan ends his night by recording the streets of New York during his cab ride home, looking out of the windshield and focused on the surrounding neighborhood.

Scope and Contents

Footage shot in Nelson's apartment: a self-portrait in a mirror in the nude, views out the windows, polished fingernails, a cat (Douglas), and the kitchen. The second half of the film depicts Nelson cooking Brown 'n' Serve sausages in a frying pan.

English

Annotated Film Containers, 1975-1990

31142054896538box: 19 (Material Type: mixed materials)

Scope and Contents

Original film containers that held 8mm and Super8mm films shot by Nelson Sullivan (see cuids 6924-6982). Handwritten annotations are found on many of the containers.

Physical Characteristics and Technical Requirements

The films have been digitized, rehoused, and stored separately for conservation reasons. See cuid6924-cuid6982 for details about the content.

Series III: Photographic Material

Subseries A: Slides

Scope and Content

Slides include:

Building of Pyramids on the Beach of F.I.: Kodachrome 64; Eddie and Freddy, Fire Island, Pyramid Scenes: Kodachrome 64, 20 exps.; Fire Island, Eddie and Freddy: Kodachrome 64; Fire Island, Nelson Haircutting Seen: Kodachrome 25; From Roof at 5 9th Ave; Good Ice Palace, Inside and Out; July 4th 1976 Cherry Grove; Masako and Her Baby, Chelsea Street, Fire Island and Nelson: some good double exposure, Kodachrome 64; Untitled

Nelson's Slides 1975-77, 1975-1977
